661C57AFC3D848D580B5A07180353057.description: evaluate group processes, and personal contributions to group processes, to determine and communicate strengths and areas for improvement

EC1321A552CE408AB559D7F8089A1535.description: identify leadership roles within a group to enhance personal leadership skills

DC0B4E9B7F934040BBBC53B51C3A7604.description: identify and demonstrate the responsibilities of each member within a group; e.g., leader, recorder, motivator

6FCE6C7FF3824615B458C69898DBC34C.description: acknowledge conflicting points of view within a group and contribute to compromise in a positive manner, using a variety of strategies; e.g., follow a problem-solving or issue-resolution model

79F2FE2A466847D3AF5FFC8BA78455A6.description: identify and model motivational techniques, e.g., positive reinforcement, suggestions and paraphrasing, to focus group members on tasks and achieve group goals

5DBC924B576343AF950817CE3FB78415.description: identify and demonstrate appropriate behaviour within a group; e.g., listen without interrupting, contribute when appropriate, disagree and/or offer suggestions in an appropriate manner

DC99564EC6EC41818604FF12FA5958E7.description: communicate appropriately with group members to develop and/or identify goals, generate ideas, monitor progress and share responsibility for the completion of a project/group goal

2769D46551D44C9EB12DB29A4C68FF9F.description: distinguish among constructive criticism, ridicule and sarcasm and identify strategies to respond appropriately

0AEE7CD8AEA045F5B96365303B1C6C64.description: identify and model the behaviours of a successful student and/or worker; e.g., listen to and follow directions, seek assistance, arrive on time, organize materials, paraphrase directions, prioritize tasks and recognize expectations

F4317704CA1B4397B42089F1ED52C476.description: contribute collaboratively in group situations by asking questions and listening and building on the ideas of others

5DADB96BD490427281F3BA8B83895C80.description: demonstrate respect for their rights and the rights of others, within a group and a community, by being fair and honest, demonstrating integrity and personal ethics and by valuing equity within the group

25EA13F9B80142FC97CEDEAB8712E000.description: use inclusive language and behaviour and create texts in ways that demonstrate respect for people of different heritage, cultures, genders, ages, abilities, opinions and communities

0BBD5FAF105F4C54B9A9FDC764E4B57F.description: participate in organizing and celebrating special events, considering the various ways language arts are used across cultures, age groups and genders to honour and celebrate people and accomplishments; e.g., Aboriginal and other cultural/community events

666DB132E6E4402DBE0325F8B5A6F22B.description: identify and compare the ways in which texts reflect specific elements of cultures or periods in history; e.g., Aboriginal peoples

61737BACE581423DA8F87CB269384793.description: clarify and enhance their understanding, perspectives and opinions by examining the ideas of others

489E8852FA0C47F1A2BD79BF0DEB45A6.description: recognize that individual differences and perspectives are influenced by culture, religion, age, gender and experiences and are valuable and honourable

80A8839F386B4C4CA7D5B185775923F9.description: examine how ideas, people, experiences and cultural traditions and values are portrayed in print and nonprint texts and compare their own with others’ understanding; e.g., Aboriginal oral stories and artifacts

125B93F0774F415D85DD0BB199DFC238.description: Respect themselves and others and strengthen community

2B18099F441549DD804B49D7689C89D4.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to respect, support and collaborate with others.

11EA8B172C5F4A17AF630FB5F602D7AA.description: use appropriate listening and viewing skills to demonstrate respect and consideration; e.g., make eye contact, nod and face the presenter/presentation

6937F758545148ADAF42735BADF05887.description: listen and view attentively and actively to carry out instructions; e.g., identify important ideas, organize and classify information

7E4BA4ADBB334CD88AB61DF50CD2C94D.description: integrate a variety of media and display techniques, as appropriate, to enhance the appeal and accuracy of presentations

B4098182B448427988209DE40361F11D.description: plan and shape presentations to achieve particular purposes or effects and use feedback to make modifications

EEB1A0888B1A42C099FD28AF662FB139.description: Use effective oral and visual communication

3D16A041F92E4BF28D008884587AC99B.description: clarify and support ideas or opinions with details, visuals or media techniques

E84149DA836E4A3AB861830CDF6D4B8B.description: select and organize graphics effectively to communicate and support information and ideas

55D56F76FF2748FDB09CC07E32401B7D.description: recognize the need for preparedness in effective communication

5A9B0B610EB14597A178846D53C8ECD3.description: apply appropriate verbal and nonverbal strategies when presenting; e.g., tone, volume, eye contact, gestures and posture

872B4B3846B441259C779BC3E5080E7F.description: recognize that different settings may require different techniques or different forms of verbal and nonverbal communication; e.g., volume at different settings and the size of visuals

367938F873464C8D9BED7B5D9F8EB19B.description: plan and create short, small-group, whole-class and other presentations to share information and ideas

A393F2B5CD6E4645BDDEB8DE475888BF.description: present information using various forms of print and nonprint texts; e.g., posters, documents, charts, graphs, timetables, calendars, paintings, drawings, collages, cartoons, multimedia presentations and Web pages

D5E7F0033A3640DFAE4CEB9BF0423B8D.description: apply appropriate common conventions when integrating information gathered from various sources; e.g., word processing, publishing, multimedia software, spreadsheets, graphics and database templates

9DC0DE76FF6E4D548CC83AF514D2D933.description: identify everyday situations in which careful attention to correct capitalization and punctuation is particularly important; e.g., cover letters for employment and writing at the workplace

C9A9C7496D9C499D85077A38E9F56284.description: use appropriate capitalization and punctuation when referencing oral, print and other texts

0E56AFCCBBC044E38D9D6EDB07C19938.description: attend to capitalization and punctuation conventions; e.g., use periods and commas appropriately with quotation marks, use commas to separate phrases and clauses in their own writing

363D1397FB6E4345BC2C1474506C5018.description: identify everyday situations in which careful attention to correct spelling is particularly important; e.g., complete forms and schoolwork

A96EFE57992245A0B00D3744DA388C79.description: use a variety of strategies to verify or correct spelling; e.g., dictionary, thesaurus and electronic software

C16DA52228AA43E8A784B2E31DCCEBAB.description: develop a systematic and effective approach to studying and remembering the correct spelling of key words

7FED6AADFD2D46C88ABA6529512D791C.description: attend to spelling conventions; e.g., confirm spelling, remember key words, develop and use their knowledge of spelling generalization and how words are formed

3FF600B9D40444A7A2723B566C202E3C.description: distinguish between formal and informal language conventions and recognize the appropriate use of each; e.g., oral language use during a job interview and when speaking with friends

584AA7805AC0410A88A6DF7CEE1B0F0F.description: attend to grammar conventions; e.g., subject-verb agreement in sentences; use of a variety of simple, compound and complex sentences; use of transitional devices and pronouns; use of consistent verb tenses

4155D04FBFBC42E6A3321BD8F4F7AF58.description: use appropriate tools, e.g., handbooks, exemplars, models, dictionaries, spell and grammar check software, to assist in attending to conventions

19A5CF151FED4CCDBAEDC7B7F56AB825.description: use metacognition strategies to examine the effectiveness and limitations of various forms of texts for an intended purpose and audience

B31791B249C94029A9DE7A1C66E5A4B6.description: use a consistent style within a print or multimedia product; e.g., layout, headers, footers, margins and columns

F56940D2800A471C81F3F14B2C384B24.description: explore and select appropriate aspects of style, e.g., font size and style, colours, spacing of text, image placement, sound and video links, within the presentation form or product, to convey meaning to the audience

AF0E67E7728644948135F52E5F8DC983.description: experiment with figurative language, illustrations, voice, sentence patterns, video effects, music and other techniques to provide emphasis, express emotion or create a mood

99A949051ED64C5E9EA2199D6A01B6B9.description: identify and infer the literal and figurative meanings of words and/or phrases in context using metaphors, similes, idioms and analogies

8347237FBBF5480FB71B32563CC36228.description: recognize that new words, phrases and manners of expression enter the language through popular culture, technology and other languages

CF24D751CF8D4AF1AF1FB4481B254651.description: identify the differences between standard English, slang, colloquialisms and jargon, and the denotative and connotative meanings of words, and examine how these differences affect meaning; e.g., accent or dialect in local communities/regions

06C950765F7E4C5C8747AC30FAB545E4.description: use an appropriate handwriting style, word processor, font type and size, graphics and other techniques to produce their own texts, considering the content, audience and purpose

15D0835A3ADA4D0E989D4F8A59A3B9DE.description: demonstrate the effective effort and behaviour required to achieve a goal or create a product; e.g., be positive, focus on the goal, work independently and/or in groups as appropriate, take initiative

54DD201B686848DCBC225DCC5B977D88.description: revise to enhance sentence structure and variety, word choice and appropriate tone and to eliminate unnecessary repetition

43076D74FF254E5897DA040F3DFCF536.description: revise the introduction, conclusion and supporting ideas and information to enhance coherence and clarify meaning

9D5835D73B4849C3B7AF6D0BCE039B38.description: revise to ensure consistency of content in the use of a main idea, a point of view and supporting details

EF1CDEA929EC466894577BC6A06488E8.description: select and use appropriate tools to edit and revise; e.g., dictionary, thesaurus and electronic editing functions

6C1E7CADB5D4430F976B44ED90F0EA99.description: proofread, edit and revise to follow language conventions; e.g., capitalization, punctuation, sentence structure, parts of speech, dialogue, grammar, spelling and word usage

8CCE757CE6404B8BB640E9D056AD8C2E.description: work collaboratively to make appropriate revisions based on feedback

8BA28C85EE224C15AD9B9AC9E556DA83.description: apply appropriate metacognition strategies to appraise their own and others' work

253F2304057649748E9BD907301D61F4.description: identify and assess content and presentation features that enhance or detract from the product and suggest/make changes

CF1E29F4CBAF44B7B401175C90666C79.description: examine the content and effectiveness of the product/presentation, considering the intended audience, purpose and form

51ED375A2C8F4354BAD3BB3B38E9DAAF.description: determine if directions have been followed and if the product is on topic and demonstrates unity and coherence

14004C33975646CF89A1F967DFADA035.description: share oral, print and other media texts, in draft form, in a way that will elicit useful feedback

13DCA6937D584A54AC84139DD961ED77.description: Appraise their own and others' work

702EB8E3FEAA453786C839005854876C.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to enhance the clarity and artistry of communication.

F6D62B8D151541FD9ECCAA7AA48ED4A0.description: identify their strengths and areas for improvement in their personal research skills and research plan

B5DB1AD67B754DED8051C6C6C694D669.description: demonstrate responsibility for following appropriate security and safety measures when using technology and the Internet; e.g., language and etiquette, ergonomics to promote personal health and well-being and respect the products and privacy of others

5CED17A4CC2C42078CDD8047E36072A7.description: apply the appropriate moral and ethical standards acceptable for a presentation

9F07EE4F222F45909410EC69FF6A1C35.description: use appropriate oral, visual, print and/or other media effectively to inform and engage the audience

9CB656A2704B4EB6A1C92B69F63EA09A.description: communicate ideas and information in a variety of oral, print and other media texts; e.g., posters, photo essays, brochures, video/multimedia presentations, interviews, newspaper articles and expository/descriptive oral reports

1F57552987F247B2BA2DAE63D0F80839.description: recognize that different viewpoints on issues may exist and that information may have a bias or be limited

C831CAA906DF41A8BC2432F85603B639.description: use appropriate criteria and metacognition strategies to assess whether the information gathered is relevant, important, accurate, complete, current and significant to determine its usefulness to the overall purpose, audience and form of presentation

E5E4C0AEA7A04787B5D9D5B99EA63715.description: reference information sources using appropriate form and consistency

A10638C9ED5A4D30B7FD4B5CAB84C536.description: use appropriate keyboarding techniques, e.g., proper fingering when using alphabet and punctuation keys, and apply appropriate strategies to increase accuracy and speed

BABE3C79279E464BAB0574CCD0873685.description: record information accurately and completely, in a consistent and appropriate style, using quotations and citing sources within footnotes and using word processing software when appropriate

EA80629C841C45178EAC5AF41A8A7B87.description: make notes in point form, summarizing main ideas and supporting details, using appropriate strategies; e.g., headings, subheadings, key words, supporting details and phrases and graphic organizers

02EB11E8A87C4F4DA38152B6329133A3.description: integrate ideas and information using their prior knowledge and new information and ideas

15D0C7B17B494BC59D1FF09B4B031359.description: organize ideas and information, logically and creatively, using categories, questions, sequence and technology, as appropriate

B8FF84648A2A4534A7FDF98B962A3773.description: select alternate information sources as appropriate

0D46AF7CD6CF4110B9DA19D7918B9CFD.description: use pre-established criteria to assess whether sources of information are credible, factual, current and appropriate to the purpose, audience and form of presentation

D21CB024E8674BA3A36FAC62D632148A.description: select appropriate technologies for gathering, generating and recording information and other materials to create a product

73ACC18FD1AF443083756930E6D64438.description: record key ideas and information using appropriate strategies; e.g., take notes and use technology

E42F3FB22856425599BCE0CF6E9B7E46.description: distinguish between fact and opinion in information

6170E87673D2497DA0F86C280F344684.description: scan and/or skim to locate specific information quickly, using textual cues and other strategies

326D7497FD7F44D5B5B2EC015BD8C05F.description: access information using a variety of tools and text features; e.g., headings, bolding, summaries, key words, electronic searches, visual and sound effects, page layouts, font styles and sizes

33956299623F4BC19E43B2EA74C92826.description: use a variety of oral, print, visual and multimedia information sources appropriate to the inquiry; e.g., textbooks, encyclopedias, graphs, oral stories, artifacts, diagrams, posters, pictures, films, community members, databases, CD-ROMs and the Internet

36DF33532A80490E89BF829762EF4B60.description: assess and modify their plan as needed

4B8DBBCB21514FD995572A274E8CCDF4.description: create a plan to access, gather, record, organize and present information, considering the topic, time, purpose, audience, form, access to technology and other resources and using appropriate strategies; e.g., webs, outlines and discussions

34C1FE4A6DAB4DA1B8DC35F3FD16F071.description: select appropriate information sources for a topic, audience, purpose and form; e.g., library, encyclopedia, community members and Web sites

FA0797A2244A45E0807DB29897F39E1B.description: identify and record their prior knowledge related to a topic and determine information gaps

42F2117BE2784BDAA0D29CAAF3C35ACC.description: use note taking, outlining or representing strategies to summarize important ideas and information in oral, print and other media texts

49236B0DCDBC4859840666D38F858D19.description: identify a tentative presentation form appropriate to the audience, purpose and point of view

239E1540CFE14BD2B5AD557D1C3FEE07.description: create categories and questions using who, what, where, when, why and how to guide inquiry and topic development

DB0213B2D1D441C587282FFA2F570643.description: consider a variety of factors that may influence a topic; e.g., audience, purpose, point of view and form

BAB3AF245B9C4829B10633F843163660.description: use metacognition and a variety of other strategies, e.g., discussions, brainstorms and webs, to identify a topic and focus ideas

6625B100A057407CBBA907935189F2B9.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to manage ideas and information.

3C5807102DBB4E618E5C7C08E010A476.description: complete actual, or samples of, common home- and work-related forms; e.g., Social Insurance Number (SIN) form, job application form and performance checklists

FB45EE10F0864CABBA86988F89A6BDE4.description: create a variety of texts to examine the connections between form, elements and techniques; e.g., advertisements, brochures, book jackets, plays, poetry, instruction sheets, posters and multimedia presentations

EF00A9009408463689EFED56C0F52686.description: create a variety of oral, print and other media texts with well-developed, supported and linked ideas and components, including: personal correspondence, e.g., personal letters, e-mail messages, using electronic and other templates as appropriate and descriptive, persuasive, expository and narrative paragraphs

F9376723BFF94E92BF47E9A9A60C4975.description: use a variety of techniques to communicate meaning and enhance the effectiveness of texts; e.g., colour, shape, composition, suspense, foreshadowing, flashbacks, word choice, gestures, movement, balance, camera angles, framing, irony and symbolism

0C901D298F284919AEA77B715A3FEE5D.description: Elaborate on the expression of ideas

AFF6CC67EFBC41EA87282349EB566772.description: create oral, print and other media texts related to issues encountered in their own life

F2A7836EBE934C80A6E908E725DF5772.description: apply appropriate prewriting strategies to generate ideas and focus a topic; e.g., discussion, brainstorm, webs, outlines, journals, graphic organizers and technology

D9599E8A57574643AF1C154C6B2E3B74.description: take ownership of text creation by selecting a topic, concept or idea that is personally meaningful, engaging and based on personal experience and/or prior knowledge

5557DAA588544EF180A63171BCE46FE2.description: explore the creative uses of language and visuals in popular culture, e.g., cartoons, animated films, limericks, advertisements, electronic and print magazines and the Internet, and communicate ways in which imagery and figurative language, e.g., simile, hyperbole and metaphor, convey meaning, tone and mood

D8148F0748F840EF9DE5630ADFCF54A6.description: summarize the content of media texts and examine the choices made in planning and producing them

FC9C18F543A742E6A2D05336BB907BB4.description: examine how sound and image work together to create effects in media texts

63B3AE72B1AD489DB5C75F5B63A12ABC.description: identify graphic design techniques, e.g., graphic quality, colour, sound, camera angle, composition, movement and editing, that create and/or manipulate emotion, mood and point of view

0CEBD0CB3B9A4E1FA8124D0A4724B109.description: examine how narrative hooks, foreshadowing, flashbacks, suspense and surprise endings contribute to the effectiveness of plot development

DED26855489540A187548AC38241F92D.description: examine the effectiveness of different types of forms for presenting ideas and information; e.g., presentations of news through television, radio and newspapers; CDs and music videos

E25F3174004A4C149907475B958F17D9.description: identify various forms and genres of oral, print and other media texts and identify the key characteristics of each

DB04D113848F4059B377EDDE1D3AB3AA.description: examine how the choice of form and genre in oral, visual and multimedia texts is appropriate to the purpose and audience

1F1B631F0E2548B7B8D8E78DB48C3619.description: recognize and appreciate the use and effectiveness of a variety of techniques, e.g., word choice, camera angle, irony, symbolism, line and framing, in communicating meaning and enhancing the text experience for the audience

788F9DFEA38B4378B92F96FA5487267C.description: examine the ways that a character can be developed and how character, plot and setting are interconnected, mutually supportive and work together to create mood and tone

A26F7F98F61C418E91EFF391C6CCFB8E.description: use a variety of strategies to understand and follow oral directions; e.g., paraphrase, mental maps, take notes

3AFF31789A5E4B598704623C2DD82805.description: differentiate between fact and fiction in media portrayals of everyday life

A815A396189945479327E1A0A847BEB2.description: define their own interpretation of texts, based on experience, prior knowledge and evidence from the text

76673D7BF0584966B9659463A1290169.description: identify conflict and examine how it develops and may be resolved

24095C6FE8A64C7BAAF3515E21192105.description: identify the main message and supporting details from various texts; e.g., short stories, articles, novels, electronic sources, CD-ROMs, television commercials and directions to complete tasks

54027C36EC374022928CD33CAF48B95E.description: compare the choices and behaviours of characters portrayed in texts to themselves and others

FD4DAA24CE2E483898406C305CFE51F2.description: examine how a character changes as a result of an event within a plot by examining elements of character; e.g., personality traits, motivation, relationships, attitudes and values

36DD1569AA9E471C869D9180AE9F2241.description: use metacognition and other appropriate strategies, e.g., graphic organizers and technology, to categorize parts of a plot, e.g., introduction, characters, setting, initial incident, rising action, climax, falling action, resolution and main conflict, and recognize their relationships in developing a story

27D5878D39554A0999F3E44FF10253EC.description: justify their point of view and interpretation using evidence from a text

96AFB80AC9144C4899D7C7FAEB39ED5B.description: consider the historical context when developing points of view or interpretations of texts

7FEEE5ECF75B4B7DB80D1A4D5C80C5E1.description: recognize that many interpretations of the same text exist and examine other points of view

897D3D94682C4A629A1C41AE9ED58E69.description: explore and experience a range of print and nonprint texts from a variety of cultural traditions and genres; e.g., journals, magazine articles, nature programs, diaries, drama, poetry, mysteries, historical fiction, drawings, prints, photographs, advertisements, Aboriginal oral stories, artifacts, films, essays, electronic and print magazines and realistic fiction

96D1C32436EA41269636C37525AB45DB.description: skim and scan reference materials to confirm spelling, locate meaning, extend vocabulary, verify usage and address uncertainties; e.g., dictionary, thesaurus, writer's handbook, personal glossary and computer software

3CF4D3ECB99446D2984843B184E17CB1.description: select and apply effective strategies to build on their strengths or address areas for improvement; e.g., context clues, dictionary use, spelling/vocabulary computer software and personal glossary

F90AB67E1C8E439CB667600072958A47.description: apply their knowledge of phonics, sight vocabulary and context cues to enhance vocabulary development and spelling

7EFE39CF71804C7FA14F43A31725D218.description: identify and use a variety of cues to enhance their understanding of nonprint texts; e.g., colour, setting, shape, movement, lighting, camera angle and size of images

BB66B5F200B34778BA2F95946436E2D6.description: use visual and textual cues and structural features to enhance their comprehension of a variety of everyday print and nonprint texts and to read and view with purpose; e.g., newspapers, magazines, instruction manuals, advertisements, schedules and Web sites

5057FE4B685B4DDBB3309A3AA27CA3FE.description: use a variety of textual cues to enhance understanding; e.g., indexes, tables of contents, chapters, bolded words/phrases, charts, glossaries, graphics and bullets

64AE84A97B0E434D96AFDC34E22CB441.description: identify a speaker's nonverbal communication strategies to increase understanding; e.g., posture, eye contact, facial expression and gestures

FAD13603496B406BABBEE4FC3BBC1553.description: identify and examine the appropriate communication strategies used to convey intent such as verbal/ nonverbal mood indicators; e.g., use of lighting, camera angle, irony, sarcasm, gestures, volume and tone

1F3EE5E9C5AD497985AB08F1E9AB0A64.description: use metacognition and a variety of other strategies to identify and remember main ideas and relevant information in print and nonprint texts; e.g., concept map, mental rehearsal, paraphrase, question and take notes

3AB2BBC4C79A4CFF8F46AD00B83BA5B6.description: paraphrase directions or key messages from various sources, e.g., oral directions, assignments, manuals, diagrams, forms, lists, labels and workbooks, to enhance and verify their understanding of tasks

364F21E5F75F449CB22F8F60C7ECEF61.description: identify vocabulary specific to a topic to enhance understanding

1BD3A251A5F24815BC0503EBF5597496.description: apply a variety of vocabulary strategies, e.g., word attack skills, context clues and dictionary skills, to enhance their comprehension of oral, print and multimedia texts

640759F47DA243A381EAE68108DC47C6.description: apply appropriate reading strategies to enhance understanding; e.g., skim, read out loud, form questions, make predictions, reread and read slowly)

C85B3A7F5B044263B1BBA3C26538E9E9.description: recognize that an interpretation of the same text may vary based on prior knowledge and individual experience

D914BD1559E745A09BD8FDD459B4E6E6.description: use their knowledge of text creators, forms and genres, developed during previous experiences, to direct and extend experiences with print and nonprint texts

D5B7766E698B444BA56D17A6F0765189.description: connect new ideas and information to prior knowledge to enhance their understanding of print and nonprint texts

21CA239C81984341A48306EC0E3590C7.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to comprehend and respond personally and critically to oral, print and other media texts.

2E8FA0A6A1EB484B95BDF718D350058B.description: revise their initial understandings, points of view and responses, based on new ideas, information and feedback

984ACEEDE0C648CE97D60A147D6BBA99.description: use a variety of strategies to examine, clarify and assess understanding; e.g., discuss, review, reread and reflect

8B7772DC84B1445FB2CFBD64C7A837C6.description: apply metacognition and other strategies to share, examine and re-examine points of view, opinions, experiences, perspectives and interpretations through discussion or by using various communication technologies; e.g., telephone, e-mail

D7BEA739AA924552879A51E7D32DCF1B.description: identify the purpose, message and intended audience of a communication and verify understanding

38FC4E1542D44950B75472BBD7EE0553.description: synthesize information from a variety of sources to extend understanding and perspective

20DA31C0D3784518A2C0BF2463714B1F.description: examine and re-examine ideas, information and experiences from different points of view to find patterns and relationships

A3F7F9D7D179426097F723DB4E9D6747.description: exchange ideas and opinions to clarify understanding and to broaden their personal perspectives

BA4619BD644543AEA1214B744CE35F26.description: assess and revise their personal opinions and ideas, based on alternative opinions and ideas

B6F80687C609482D81D28AA2620705F1.description: acknowledge the value of, and respond constructively to, the ideas and opinions of others when exploring and extending their personal interpretation and perspectives

9F3FF0EE9A1C4372A9709F8C0E25A942.description: review and revise their language learning plan design to extend language growth

EF4E610D36CE4CB8BEFC7FE4389E5CA9.description: investigate career-related language skills using self-evaluation and other strategies to identify attainable career opportunities; e.g., Alberta Learning Information Service (ALIS) Web site, National Occupation Classification (NOC)

121472AEE0DB4F26B28D8636D5BEAFB8.description: create a language learning plan to meet attainable secondary, post-secondary and career goals and include a record/collection of achievements and goals; e.g., career portfolio

959D3AE263BB45948512747A25046076.description: apply self-evaluation and other strategies and tools, e.g., checklists and inventories, to identify language strengths and weaknesses and develop personal language learning goals

ECE20140C50E42D0A615BCC0813A3106.description: identify and explain the reasons for their personal preferences; e.g., genres, artists, storytellers, filmmakers and authors

25DCEED1842B4D259E97B1CD2FC2F118.description: extend experiences by exploring and assessing a variety of print and nonprint texts, based on personal preferences and recommendations from others

6D6587E47AC14DD8B4460FAC42AF917F.description: experiment with language to enhance language development; e.g., use new vocabulary, vary sentence structure and use figurative language

BFA1C524C7C645A9B468E50DA2244FA4.description: examine ways that language and forms influence the development and communication of ideas, information and experiences in print and nonprint texts; e.g., read a novel, view a film adaptation and compare the development and communication of the story

8E1D927413CA44158286EC2854FA7B8A.description: experiment with language, form, structure and images to create different effects, considering purpose and audience

0D90660F47CD42E49E0D5D45CD881D0F.description: extend their understanding by taking different points of view when reviewing and reflecting on print and nonprint texts

55B6505E7F794893A10544CA6E9AF72C.description: extend and revise their understanding of ideas and information by exploring a variety of print and nonprint texts on related topics and themes

E5A49F218F64430EB9CCE50794C3C6F9.description: extend and revise their understanding of ideas and information by connecting new and prior knowledge and personal experiences

DDC4E8A45CE2480A8A772AB460A1E968.description: Students will listen, speak, read, write, view and represent to explore thoughts, ideas, feelings and experiences.
